==What to Check For==

Verify that code is obfuscated with //ProGuard//.

==Why==

Obfuscate the application binary with //ProGuard// to make it more difficult to reverse engineer.

==How to Check==

To verify that code is obfuscated with //ProGuard//:

# **Verify that //ProGuard// is configured.** Make sure the //proguard.cfg// file is present. Examine the //proguard.cfg// file to make sure that it suits the application.
# **Verify that //ProGuard// is enabled.** Verify that the //proguard.config// property in the //project.properties// file points to the location of the //proguard.cfg// file.
# **Verify that the application is built in release mode.** Examine the build environment to make sure that it is set to release mode.


==How to Fix==

To obfuscate code with //ProGuard//:

# **Configure //ProGuard//.** Edit the //proguard.cfg// file to suit your application.
# **Enable //ProGuard//.** Change the //proguard.config// property in the //project.properties// file to point to the location of the //proguard.cfg// file.
# **Enable release mode.** //ProGuard// is executed automatically by the Android build system when it is used to build applications in release mode.
# **Build the application.** Build your application in release mode to obfuscate the binary with //ProGuard//.
